description: Graphs related to the sequencer (also known as the state keeper)

panels.description: Transactions per second: how many are added to mempool and how many are executed in the state keeper.
panels.title: Transactions per second

panels.description: Average - time that state keeper spends waiting for a transaction in mempool. When non-zero - that means that the mempool is empty. When zero - that state keeper is working at highest throughput. The value is capped at one second - if we need to wait more, we start over. That means that if there are no incoming transactions, the graph will show flat line at one second
panels.title: Waiting for transaction

panels.description: Histogram - time that state keeper spends waiting for a transaction in mempool. When non-zero - that means that the mempool is empty. When zero - that state keeper is working at highest throughput. The value is capped at one second - if we need to wait more, we start over. That means that if there are no incoming transactions, the graph will show flat line at one second
panels.title: Waiting for Transaction

panels.description:
The time transactions spend in the mempool. More precisely, time delta between a transaction's `received_at` DB field (which is recorded when transaction is first persisted) and the miniblock time the tx is included in.
This doesn't include some other time that affects tx submission user experience, like estimate_gas time, submit_raw_tx time, polling time etc.
panels.title: Tx Inclusion wait time (10m aggregation)

panels.description:
The time transactions spend in the mempool. More precisely, time delta between a transaction's `received_at` DB field (which is recorded when transaction is first persisted) and the miniblock time the tx is included in.
This doesn't include some other time that affects tx submission user experience, like estimate_gas time, submit_raw_tx time, polling time etc.
panels.title: Tx Inclusion wait time

panels.description: Average time it takes to save the miniblock in Postgres. See "miniblock stage ... " rows below
panels.title: Seal Miniblock DB Time - average

panels.description: Histogram of the time it takes to seal a miniblock and its data - mostly DB time. See "miniblock stage ... " rows below.
panels.title: Seal Miniblock DB Time

panels.description: Available capacity of miniblock seal queue
panels.title: Miniblock seal queue capacity

panels.description: Average time it takes to save the miniblock divided by the number of txs in it.
panels.title: [WIP] Seal Miniblock Time per transaction

panels.description: There are multiple reasons why we'd want to seal l1 batch - this graph shows how often and why we seal l1 batches
panels.title: L1 batch Seal Reason

panels.description: Time passed while state keeper is waiting for the tree to compute the previous block root hash - it's needed to start the execution of the next l1 batch
panels.title: Waiting for Tree

panels.description: Time it takes to seal an l1 batch and its data - mostly DB time. See "l1 batch stage ... " rows below.
panels.title: L1 batch Seal Time

targets.legendFormat: l2_txs (including the ones with nonce gaps)

panels.description: Time spent on $state_keeper_seal_miniblock_stages miniblock seal stage

targets.expr: avg_over_time(avg by (pod) (rate(server_state_keeper_miniblock_sealed_time_stage_sum{stage="$state_keeper_seal_miniblock_stages", namespace=~"$namespace|", pod=~"$pod|", is_fictive=~"false|"}[$__rate_interval])/rate(server_state_keeper_miniblock_sealed_time_stage_count{stage="$state_keeper_seal_miniblock_stages", namespace=~"$namespace|", pod=~"$pod|", is_fictive=~"false|"}[$__rate_interval]))[$aggr:])

panels.title: total time - average

panels.description: Time spent on $state_keeper_seal_miniblock_stages miniblock seal stage

targets.expr: avg_over_time(avg by (pod) (rate(server_state_keeper_miniblock_sealed_entity_per_unit_sum{stage="$state_keeper_seal_miniblock_stages", namespace=~"$namespace|", pod=~"$pod|", is_fictive=~"false|"}[$__rate_interval])/rate(server_state_keeper_miniblock_sealed_entity_per_unit_count{stage="$state_keeper_seal_miniblock_stages", namespace=~"$namespace|", pod=~"$pod|", is_fictive=~"false|"}[$__rate_interval]))[$aggr:])

panels.title: per entity/row - average

panels.description: Average number of resulting/affected DB rows/entities from $state_keeper_seal_miniblock_stages when saving miniblock execution result.

targets.expr: avg_over_time(avg by (pod) (rate(server_state_keeper_miniblock_sealed_entity_count_sum{stage="$state_keeper_seal_miniblock_stages", namespace=~"$namespace|", pod=~"$pod|", is_fictive="false"}[$__rate_interval])/rate(server_state_keeper_miniblock_sealed_entity_count_count{stage="$state_keeper_seal_miniblock_stages", namespace=~"$namespace|", pod=~"$pod|", is_fictive="false"}[$__rate_interval]))[$aggr:])

panels.title: number of entities/rows - average

panels.description: Time spent on $state_keeper_seal_miniblock_stages miniblock seal stage
panels.title: total time - heatmap - $pod

panels.description: Histogram of time spent in state keeper on $state_keeper_seal_miniblock_stages when saving miniblock execution result, divided by the number of resulting/affected number DB rows/entities. Doesn't apply for all stages.
panels.title: per entity/row - heatmap - $pod

panels.description: Histogram of time spent in state keeper on $state_keeper_seal_miniblock_stages when saving miniblock execution result, divided by the number of resulting/affected DB rows/entities. Doesn't apply for all stages.
panels.title: number of entities - heatmap - $pod

list.description: If set to $__interval, no rolling average is applied. Other values are useful to analyse historical data
list.label: aggregate by
list.name: aggr

title: Era - sequencer
